justification: The CSSL model was used to predict participants' choices in a dual-environment task where they solved linear and nonlinear decision problems. This model explicitly learns to associate different environments with appropriate decision strategies, demonstrating the strategy selection process (details in 'Contextual strategy selection learning' section).

The WADD model represents a cue-based strategy often used in linear environments. In this experiment, it was used and compared with other models to predict participants' choices in the linear decision-making task (details in 'Identifying the strategies adopted by the participants' section).

The GCM is an exemplar-based model suited for nonlinear environments. It was fitted to participants' choices in the nonlinear task and compared to cue-based models to determine its effectiveness (details in 'Identifying the strategies adopted by the participants' section).

The CAM model is one of the cue-based strategies. It was found to best predict participants' choices in the linear environment, supporting its use in linear decision-making tasks (details in 'Results' and 'Behavioral analysis' sections).

measured_by: Generalized Context Model (GCM) - joint representation (jGCM γ 11)
justification: The GCM with a joint representation performed well in predicting participants' choices in the nonlinear environment, supporting the use of exemplar-based strategies in this type of task (details in 'Results' and modeling sections).
